job_description:
• Understanding process variation, disturbances, wear-out and other error sources in semiconductor memories, and how it influences error detection & correction requirements Willingness to work on a varying mix of research- and demonstration-focused assignments depending on the changing needs of a pathfinding organization Familiarity with compute scaling, parallel computing and shared memory technologies (CXL, NvLink, UALink, OpenMP, MPI, etc.
• ) is desired Current PhD or Master's student with the relevant experience below, and must not graduate before September 2026.
• Knowledge of how compute system architecture and memory scaling impact AI and ML workflows and models Background in statistics and data science with experience in appropriate tools (e.
• Python, Jupyter) Understanding and experience in neural network quantization and LoRA fine-tuning techniques Experience with application performance benchmarking on heterogeneous (CPU + GPU) systems Experience implementing AI workflows using AI/ML frameworks (PyTorch, TensorFlow, etc.
• ) Experience and understanding of AI denoising techniques such as CNNs, GANs and VAEs.
